meanings.definition: A temporary solution to a problem.
meanings.sent1: When the main road was closed, they used a stopgap route to reach their destination.
meanings.sent2: The band-aid was just a stopgap until they could get proper medical attention.
meanings.sent3: Using a stopgap measure, they managed to keep the leaky faucet from flooding the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The stopgap solution patched up the issue for now, but a permanent fix was needed.
meanings.sent5: The stopgap plan was like a bandage on a wound, providing temporary relief.

meanings.definition: Something that fills a gap or serves as a temporary substitute.
meanings.sent1: The spare tire was a stopgap until they could get the flat tire fixed.
meanings.sent2: The substitute teacher was a stopgap while the regular teacher was on maternity leave.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella served as a stopgap shield from the sudden rain shower.
meanings.sent4: The temporary bridge acted as a stopgap until the permanent one could be built.
meanings.sent5: The stopgap measure kept the project going until the new equipment arrived.
